results.description:
The new time for the Sunday meetup is 8:00 am to try to beat the heat.

We have to limit the RSVPs to 12 because 3 of the 6 courts at Hillwood are being resurfaced.

Come on out and join us for pickup mixed doubles on Sunday mornings! With mild Tennessee winters, the odds are good that we will play throughout the late fall and winter.


If you RSVP, please commit to either being there or providing plenty of notification of cancelling to enable as many as possible to play. Thanks!
results.name: West Nashville Pick-up Doubles and Singles

results.description:
Looking for some extra miles? Join us for these longer paddles in order to boost endurance, improve technique, and practice your onboard skills while enjoying the beautiful stretches of the Cumberland River

Reservations must be made

at www.paddleupnashville.com or Book Now!

Note: RSVPs on Meet Up will not guarantee a reservation.

Arrive 15 minutes early to get signed in and set up on a board to paddle promptly at 10:00

Board rental is $35

Drop-in is $10

Store your board with Paddle Up Nashville?..free
results.name: Mileage Builders

group.name: Stand Up Paddle Boarding in Nashville TN.

results.description:
Our SUP 101 Class is sure to get you on the water with the techniques you need to get started having fun Stand Up Paddle Boarding. This information packed 1 hour and 15 minutes class will leave you ready to get back on board and try out your new skills and enjoy being out side on the beautiful Cumberland River!

Reservations must be made at www.paddleupnashville.com or Book Now!

Note: RSVPs on Meet Up will not guarantee a reservation.

Class is $45 includes all needed equipment. Arrive 15 minutes early to get signed in and set up for class.

Sunscreen, water and ready to have fun is all that is needed!

Sign our waiver here:

https://www.smartwaiver.com/v/paddleupwaiver/
results.name: SUP 101 Everything you wanted to know but were afraid to ask...

group.name: Stand Up Paddle Boarding in Nashville TN.

results.description:
Join us for our Fitness OnBoard Classes as they move outside until October

A Fast paced classed designed to get you in shape "boot camp" style! A great way to take your favorite work out to a new environment. Experience high intensity , full body work outs that target strength, cardio, flexibility, core and muscle endurance on a paddle board. This class is open to anyone and everyone, whether it's you first time on a paddle board or your 100th.

Reservations must be made at <a>www.paddleupnashville.com or</a>

<a> Book Now!</a>

Note: RSVPs on Meet Up will not guarantee a reservation.

Class is $20 (when RSVP online)
$25 walk-ins

Arrive 15 minutes early to get signed in and set up, class starts promptly at 10:30
results.name: OnBoard Fitness Class at Paddle Up Nashville

group.name: Stand Up Paddle Boarding in Nashville TN.

This is generally the biggest game of the week, and it gets a bit hectic.

Please keep the games friendly and self-organize as much as possible.


As usual, Centennial is the backup location.
results.name: Sunday Soccer 4:00pm @ Elmington

results.description:
Hello friends

Come on out and enjoy Nashville Shores Annual Fireworks display....

You...bring along your kayak and lights and food to grill and a side to share a chair if you like...

GEAR: kayak will be available for a small donation of $15pp...YOU...need to bring two sources of lights, flash lights or head lamp is grt. let me know on your RSVP for gear....

Time: 5:00pm at Cooks landing
results.name: Nashville Shore...FIREWORKS  Dinner Paddle

results.description:
Hike distance: 5 miles

Duration: 1 1/2 hrs

Pace: nonstop, moderate to fast

Look for us in the pavilion.

Join us for our special early July 4th hike. We will do this nonstop hike at a moderate to rapid pace, walking on the paved path along the Little Harpeth River until we get to Crockett Park. We will then walk along various paths within the park before we turn around and return.

Please be aware that the event hosts usually arrive 15 minutes early and that we are waiting for you. If you change your mind and decide not to go, please change your RSVP. The hike begins at 8:00 am but if everyone arrives early we will leave early.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet in the parking lot across the street from the Brentwood public library.  Take the Concord Rd exit on I65 and go east about a quarter mile and make a right at the light (Knox Valley Dr).  The parking lot is on the left. - See images below.
results.name: River walk to Crockett Park

group.name: Hiking Club of Nashville and Suburbs

results.description:
Hike distance: 5 miles

Duration: 1 1/2 hrs

Pace: nonstop, moderate to fast

We will do this nonstop hike at a moderate pace and will likely do a couple of laps around Centennial park to take advantage of the shade before we cross the street to wander around the Vanderbilt campus. If you want to join us and are running late, call or text Steve at (631) 943-2688.

Plan on arriving at least 10 minutes early as it may be crowded on this holiday. Look for a parking spot in the Parthenon parking lot and then make your way over to the statue. If you change your mind or can not make it, let us know. The hike begins at 11 am but we will leave early if everyone is there early.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet by the statue of John Thomas on the south side (McDonald's side) of the Parthenon. See images below.
results.name: Monday Morning Hike - Centennial Park/West End

group.name: Hiking Club of Nashville and Suburbs

results.description: In town? Want to get out of the house and share a potluck lunch with others? Prepare your favorite dish, and we'll share it in a round-table like feast. Bring games, i.e. card games, board games, frisbees, etc. and we can work up an appetite before we eat. We'll share good food, fun and conversation. So, you in? I've selected Centennial Park due to its central location, but I'm open to other locations as well. Your ideas are welcomed! R.S.V.P. now!
results.name: 4th of July Celebration

venue.name: Shelby Bottoms Boat Ramp River Access

results.description:
Hello friends...come on out and join several of us for this spectacular evening...What...front row seats to Nashville awesome Fireworks...

YOU: bring your kayak and all safety gear...LIGHTS, LIGHTS, LIGHTS...along with bug spray, and your snacks etc.

PUT-IN...Shelby Bottoms Boat Ramp 6:00pm...please be on time, this is a very busy ramp for boaters...

ASAP..we will shuttle to our takeout point,,,drivers be ready to roll after you unload.......all riders please move our gear to side and keep an eye on it please....

TAKE-OUT...1 mile downstream at Waterplant...

GEAR....I will have gear for a small donation of $15pp...This is for experienced kayaker only...all lifevest must be worn...
results.name: NOAC 9th Annual 4th July .FIREWORK Paddle

Make sure you bring water, towel, etc. It gets pretty sweaty.

results.name: Outdoor Fit @ Two Rivers

results.description:
HIKE STATS:
Time: Hike starts promptly at 6:30 P.M.
Place: Deep Well entrance of Percy Warner Park
Distance: 5½ total miles
Estimated Hike Time: 2+ hours
Difficulty: Moderate (Experienced hikers only. Night hikes are not best for beginners.)
Hike Leader: Mike Hicks
Notes: Dogs on a leash okay (Park regs require no more than 6-ft leash - you may be ticketed if you fail to use a leash!)


The Mossy Ridge Trail is the longest of the three loop footpaths in the Warner Parks. An ideal training hike, the path leaves the Deep Well trailhead and winds through rich hollows and dry ridges of the Harpeth Hills, making frequent but never sustained elevation changes. Scattered in the woods are big trees and a spring-fed waterfall. At 4.5 miles, the Mossy Ridge Trail qualifies as a full-fledged hike that will not disappoint.
Description courtesy of Johnny Molloy

Note that because of changes to parking/access at the Deep Well entrance, the hike is now ~5.5 miles.


Trail Map - https://www.nashville.gov/Portals/0/SiteContent/Parks/docs/permits/Percy%20Warner%20Park%20Map_Updated%202011-9-27.pdf

Directions to Deep Well entrance of Percy Warner Park:
From the point where Highway 100 begins at Highway 70 near the Belle Meade Post Office, head west on TN[masked] miles to the large stone gates on the left with Deep Well Entrance sign that mark the entrance of Percy Warner Park (Immediately after the Vaughn Gap Rd/Music City Bikeway Stop Light). Turn left from Highway 100 and pass through the gates, staying right when the road splits. We meet at the Highway 100 Trailhead (1st Pavilion on the left - small pavilion after the 1st set of parking areas). If coming from Old Hickory Blvd or further west, the Entrance will be on your right ~¾ miles past the Old Hickory Blvd Red Light between Edwin and Percy Warner Parks (Just before the Vaughn Gap Rd/Music City Bikeway Stop Light).

We usually have dinner afterward at the Sam's Sport's bar (at the HWY 100 & HWY 70 split).
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the Highway 100 Trailhead (1st Pavilion on left after Deep Well entrance off Hwy 100) (Near Vaughn Gap Rd/Music City Bikeway crossing)
results.name: Mossy Ridge Trail - Night Hike for Experienced hikers 07/05R

results.description:
Every day, thousands of dogs are abandoned, neglected and turned in to shelters and pounds across America. Many of these dogs are boxers. They find their way into rescue through no fault of their own. We can't save them all, but they all deserve another chance!

Join us for Tails of the Trail with Middle Tennessee Boxer Rescue when we hike with rescue boxers! Founded in 1990, MTBR is a non-profit animal rescue focused on rescue, re-home, and education of the boxer breed in Middle Tennessee.

We'll meet at Basswood Farms in Brentwood to hike with the boxers that MTBR is currently housing onsite. Only RSVP if you are capable of handling a 50+ lb. dog on a 1.5 mile road hike followed by off leash play time and perhaps a dip in the bathing pool.


Things to know before you attend our event:

• Print, sign, and bring the attached MTBR Release Form

• Read our Volunteer Orientation guide prior to arrival.

• Do bring dog treats

• Please load the app ResQwalk on your smart phone and select Middle Tennessee Boxer Rescue as your sponsored shelter so they can earn donations from our event.

Thanks to our sponsors:

Brookdale Green Hills Cumberland Senior Living

Nature's Select Pet Food Delivery of Middle TN
results.name: Tails of the Trail® - 07/06 hike w/dogs from Middle Tennessee Boxer Rescue

results.description:
Let's hike the Cane connector trail and the Red Trail at the Warner Parks.

We will meet at 6:00pm at the Nature Center off hwy 100 at Edwin Warner Park

This will be around a 6.5 mile hike. and would be considered moderate.

However keep in mind that this will be a night hike so it is better for those with some hiking experience.

We will need to start at 6pm as this is a weeknight hike.

Things to bring:

WATER and snacks for the hike. I recommend hiking boots and hiking poles. Also bring bug spray. Also a HEADLIGHT or FLASHLIGHT.

After the Hike we will eat at Cancun Mexican in Bellevue. Located at 7077 US-70S, Nashville, TN 37221

Standard Notice:
Meetup organizers/leaders are not guides. Expect the same risks and take the same precautions you would take if you were hiking alone. You are solely responsible for your own safety and well-being.

By signing up for and/or attending this Meetup event, you acknowledge, understand, accept, and agree that hiking and other outdoor activities can be dangerous and can cause serious bodily injury and possibly death. The organizers of this group and current and former members can not be held responsible or liable in any way for the actions of any participant - including you - at any event. All attendees participate at an event at their own risk and are solely responsible for any damage to their property, and/or any injury to themselves or their guests. By signing up for this event, you affirm that you understand this disclaimer, and that you knowingly and voluntarily agree not to bring any type of claim arising out of or related to this Meetup event against the organizers of this Meetup group.
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet near the restrooms. If you need to reach me call 615-352-1000
results.name: Night Hike at the Warner Parks

results.description:
Purpose: For all hikers who want to walk non-stop with moderate pace, for 5 miles through west end-Vanderbilt area.In general, we walk as 2 or more small groups (moderate or fast paced) so that a member can join any of the mini groups based on his/her comfort level.

Route-1: Acklen Ave-Love Circle- Orleans Dr-32nd Ave-Blakemore Ave- Natchez trace-Kensington plce-24th ave-Vanderbilt pl-25 Ave-Garland Ave-Vanderbilt campus-peabody college-21st Ave-Belcourt Ave-Fannie Maes Park-Eakin Elementary.

Route-2: (see map-2 below) We will start at Eakin, but follow different streets, return back to Eakin via love circle.

Start time: 6.00 pm.

Distance: 5 miles

Duration: 1.5 hrs

Changes in RSVP in the last hour: If you decide in the last hour to come for the hike or drop out of the event or getting late by a few minutes, please inform one of us by phone call or text message: Raju,[masked]; Steve:[masked] 2688. This helps the group to wait for you or depart in time.
results.how_to_find_us: Eakin Elementary School, Fairfax  and 26th Ave. See image below.
results.name: Non-stop, 5 mile Nashville West end hike

group.name: Hiking Club of Nashville and Suburbs

results.description:
* This event is free but is first RSVP first serve
* Game Format: 5 vs 5 , 3-Teams, 1 Sub/team
* Organizer will assign you to a team. We try to keep a balance of skill levels to increase competition.
* The organizer will also assign a captain to each team and he or she is RESPONSIBLE for smooth transition of subs: each player will be given a number and rotate according to that sequence every 3-5 minutes.

LATE CANCEL & NO SHOW
If you are going to be late 30 minutes or more, just cancel. If not, you will not be allowed to play the following 2 weeks. We have a very lenient late cancel policy so simply no contention, no excuses please whether there were spaces left or you were on the waiting list!

WAIT LIST

Those individuals on the waiting list, to avoid a penalty you should check your RSVP as frequently as possible the afternoon of game day. If you are unable to check your status, remove your name from the waiting list. If you decide to come and see if there is a spot, notify the organizer immediately and they will try to fit you in. If you don't, you won't play.

ETIQUETTE
1. Refrain from excessive coaching during the game.
2. Refrain from excessive use of foul language.
3. No fighting or intentional fouling, of course.

• LOCAL GAME RULES:
1. No Side & End Line! (This makes for free flowing game)
2. All kick-offs (initial or following a goal) must be taken from the back.
3. Sliding tackles are not allowed, nor any other dangerous play.

Please keep this fun and safe! Everyone gets to play, and no score is worth injury.
results.name: WEDNESDAY INDOOR GAME AT COLEMAN

results.description:
Let's relax after work and paddle the lake! Afterwards we'll hit La Hacienda Restaurant for dinner & margaritas or Sal's Pizza for some of the best pizza around and some cold ones.

Getting there:
Take I-40 to exit #219 Stewart's Ferry Pike
SOUTH on Bell Road about 3.4 miles (through 4 lights)
Watch for the brown "Hamilton Creek" sign
Turn LEFT into Hamilton Creek Park-drive to the Marina
Meet at the Marina
Mobile:[masked]

PFDs required.

Bring at least 2 lights and check your batteries. A strong light inside you boat is a great addition.

Feel free to bring a snack and a drink to tie you over until dinner.

Plan, dress, and bring extra wear in your dry bag accordingly for the weather.

http://youtu.be/ob8tFaM4Fc8

venue.name: Percy Warner Park - Bob Brown Field House

results.description:
A great hike for beginners on a moderate trail that gives a chance to try out gear and gumption while covering ~5.5 miles (~2000' of rise/fall) of reasonably groomed trails lined with some wildlife and plush woods.

If you're interested, sign up & let's meet up for a lap of Percy Warner's Mossy Ridge and chase the sun out of the park. Plan on meeting Thursdays at 6:30pm and heading to the trail no later than 6:45pm.

Rain or shine?:

Hike takes place year round in all conditions (save for high risk (windy) weather - the trail does have a lot of widow makers lurking on it).

How long does it last?:

Hike lasts around two hours (a little less on cooler nights, a bit longer on hotter nights).

Where do we meet?:

We will start from the "Cross Country" parking lot off of Highway 100 (just east of the junction at Old Hickory, picture of the parking lot below)

by the Bob Brown Field House and take the Candy Cane Connector to the Mossy Ridge trail. Depending on the group's preference, we may proceed clockwise or counter-clockwise (some feel counter-clockwise is easier) for a little variety on the Mossy Ridge trail.

Should a cross country meet be in play at the park, plan on meeting back by the Bob Brown Field house (vs. the parking lot) to make it easier to find the group & start on time.

On nights when the hike finishes at a reasonable time, we will often head to the Brewhouse 100 or Sportsman's for a little camaraderie & grub before heading home.

What do you need?:

Light(s) required to finish the hike out and ensure your safety.

Recommend carrying water as the summer nights are still quite warm well into the night.

If rain was/is in the forecast, gaiters are handy to keep mud & muck out of your boots or shoes. A light weight shell is also handy to carry if weather looks iffy.

For summer hikes, dress accordingly to vent and stay cool. Opt for synthetics over cotton to help keep yourself from being soaked and having trouble cooling.

For winter hikes, dress accordingly to vent and stay warm. The key to temperature control is staying dry, so bear that in mind as you select your layers.

Hiking boots or shoes recommended as numerous rocky areas, scree, and roots are present on the trail. So treat your feet as you see fit for comfort and safety bearing that in mind.


Bug spray highly recommended in the summer/fall months.


Poles are a personal preference thing, never use mine unless it is super slick/icy or if I twist an ankle. However, if you are prone to doing your own stunts, I'd recommend using them to provide a bit of stability.

FRS radios are welcome, default to channel 1/1 for general monitoring/use. Alternate channel is usually 7/11 for convenience. Try to keep banter to a minimum though, and let the wildlife wander peacefully.

Dogs are welcome to come along, but must be on a leash. It's the law and snakes frequent the trail. Don't risk putting your furry friend in harm's way...

The past several years have witnessed yellow jacket nests within proximity of or on the trail. If you are allergic to bee stings, please make it known to the group and travel prepared.
results.how_to_find_us: Park at the "Cross Country Parking Lot" by the Bob Brown Field House just past OHB heading towards Belle Meade on HWY100. Link in details below.
results.name: Night hikes on Mossy Ridge (Red Trail) in Percy Warner Park.

results.description:
Howdy Friends- Come on out to Big East Fork Retreat for coffee, bagels and a 6 mile hike through the Big East Fork Valley. We will begin at the Big East Fork Retreat at 9am for coffee to get the energy groovin'. After a little coffee and some socializing, we will be exploring the scenic trails around the lake, along the creek, past the farm and up Peach Orchard Hollow to the Nachez Trace then down through Sunset Meadow, a future camping site. After the hike, we will reorganize at the retreat for juice, bagels and conversation. Looking forward to seeing y'all this Saturday!

Breakfast sponsored by the Non-profit Big East Fork Center for Sustainable Stewardship, 501(c)3. Donations gladly accepted.
results.name: Let's Hike For Food!

group.name: Big East Fork Hiking & Breakfast Club

results.description:
What you get: You'll be treated to three hours of a private lesson with no more than four other people. Everything you'll need to learn how to kayak is provided with the lesson at no extra charge. You'll try out several different kayaks to find out what suits you perfectly.


***At the end of the lesson, you'll receive a free safety device gift as my way of saying Thank You, a free copy of my book, "Quiet Water Kayaking - A Beginner's Guide" and an official personalized American Canoe Association completion wallet card.***

What you'll learn: Learn to control and navigate a kayak where you want it to go, paddling safety, Universal River Signals, how to load and unload a boat, what to buy and not buy, and hot tips on safe kayaking and river etiquette. By the end of the lesson, you'll talk and feel like a paddler and have fun! Please feel free to read the great comments left by previous students.

What to bring: Wear or bring shoes that can get wet, and comfortable clothes. If you want to get 'baptized' and get your first flip out of the way, wear something that you don't mind getting wet, and bring a towel.

Children ages 8+ welcome to attend. Please contact me regarding your child's size so I can determine if any special accommodations are needed. No problem if that's the case, I love teaching children.

Please Note: Open and close the gate on the left side when you arrive. On the property proceed through the opening in the electric fence to the parking area.

In case of bad weather, please check email and/or website evening before and day of event for any potential updates. In the event of canceling the lesson, you will always have the choice of a refund or choosing another date to receive a lesson.
results.name: Private Kayak Lesson

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
